title: Review: Cholombian – Before You, It Never Snowed EP
body:
With the likes of **Bondax** and **Disclosure** causing serious waves in the UK music scene, it would appear that now is as good a time as any for young, talented producers to forge a name for themselves.

Southampton’s **Cholombian** aka **Mitchell Stevens** may still be simmering beneath the radar of most people, but it’s surely only a question of time before others pick up on his ambient electronica. Having [Introduced](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/12524-introducing-cholombian/) Stevens toward the tail end of last year, he’s increased his fanbase with the release of two EP’s, March’s _**Distance**_ and last weeks **_Before You, It Never Snowed_**.

Switching from drone based soundscapes to sampling mid-00’s **Usher** within the space of seconds, (_You Don’t Even Know What You’ve Done_), it’s within **Cholombian’s** flexibility that he really excels, toying with complex beat structures and dark, industrial synth sounds. _Kiss The Ring_ finds him borrowing vocal samples again, this time from **Wu Tang**, before the track descends into a mirage of atmospheric, metallic claps. Whilst it’s still early days for **Cholombian**, he’s rapidly building up a mightily impressive catalog of work. Check out the full EP below.
